snippet: Jet magazine, the third-largest publication aimed at African-Americans, has joined the list of scores of others that have changed their formats from print to online and mobile.
abstract: Pioneering African-American magazine Jet is expected to announce that it will no longer publish regular print edition, latest in growing list of periodicals avoiding print in favor of digital publications; its owner, Johnson Publishing Company, will move Jet to largely digital format starting in June, delivered through its website and paid subscription app.
lead_paragraph: Jet magazine, the third-largest publication aimed at African-Americans, has joined the list of scores of others that have changed their formats from print to online and mobile.

headline.main: Jet Magazine to Shift to Digital Publishing Next Month
headline.print_headline: Jet to Shift to Digital Publishing Next Month
